March 22, 2023

end-to-end exploratory data analysis problem using Python and Tableau

The problem at broader level we wanted to analyze the economic and social data of countries in G20 group with API

API: an API or application programming interface is a set of rules that allow two pieces of software to communicate with each other in other words it’s a way of one program access the data or functionality from other now the World Bank has an API that allows developers or analysts like us to receive data from various topics such as economics finance

https://wbdata.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
https://github.com/OliverSherouse/wbdata
https://blogs.worldbank.org/opendata/accessing-world-bank-data-apis-python-r-ruby-stata:

Show the code 
#!pip install wbdata
Show the code 
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

import wbdata # install first: https://wbdata.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
Show the code

from datetime import datetime
Show the code 
start_date ='2015-01-01'
end_date ='2020-12-31'

start_date_obj = datetime.strptime(start_date,"%Y-%m-%d")
end_date_obj = datetime.strptime(end_date,"%Y-%m-%d")

data_date = (start_date_obj, end_date_obj)

Show the code 
indicators[indicators['Indicator ID'] == 'NY.GDP.MKTP.CD']['Indicator Name'].values[0]
'Gross Domestic Product (GDP)'
Show the code 
df=pd.DataFrame()
Show the code 
for i in indicators['Indicator ID']:
    new_df = wbdata.get_data(indicator=i, country='all', data_date=data_date, pandas=True)
    new_df = pd.DataFrame(new_df).reset_index()
    new_df.columns = ['country','year',indicators[indicators['Indicator ID'] == i]['Indicator Name'].values[0]]
    df = pd.concat([df,new_df],axis=1)

'Gross Domestic Product (GDP)'
Show the code 
df=pd.DataFrame()
Show the code 
for i in indicators['Indicator ID']:
    new_df = wbdata.get_data(indicator=i, country='all', data_date=data_date, pandas=True)
    new_df = pd.DataFrame(new_df).reset_index()
    new_df.columns = ['country','year',indicators[indicators['Indicator ID'] == i]['Indicator Name'].values[0]]
    df = pd.concat([df,new_df],axis=1)

Outlier Proportion

Show the code 
def outlier(x):
    q1=x.quantile(0.25)
    q3=x.quantile(0.75)
    iqr = q3 - q1
    return ( x < q1-1.5*iqr)  (x>q3+1.5*iqr)

Show the code 
def top_3(data, parameter):
    year_list = data['year'].dt.year.sort_values().unique()
    result_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=year_list,index=[1,2,3])
    
    for year in year_list:
        df_year = data[data['year'].dt.year == year]
        value = df_year.groupby('country')[parameter].sum().sort_values(ascending=False).head(3).index
        result_df[year] = value
    
    return result_df
